dynamic.name: Dynamic
dynamic.description: As opposed to strongly typed, i.e., any variable can "change" type and/or be used as another type.

strongly_typed.name: Strongly-Typed
strongly_typed.description: Enforces typed variables, at compile time or at runtime, so that a variable is not mis-used resulting in runtime inconsistencies.

script.name: Scripting
script.description: The code is parsed at runtime.

native.name: Native
native.description: The code is compiled to machine (processor) native code.

il.name: IL
il.description: The code is compiled to an Intermediate Language read by the runtime.

specific_runtime.name: Specific-Runtime
specific_runtime.description: Requires a specific runtime (a program that runs the code) to be install on the computer

oop.name: Object Oriented Programming
oop.description: Programming paradigm base on the concept of objects (classes, structures) where data and functionalilty is grouped (scoped) in object definitions.

gc.name: Garbage Collection
gc.description: The process of the runtime of clearing un-used memory alocations.
